intro: Chrysanthemum tripartitum, commonly known as the three-part chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its foliage is dark green and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Chrysanthemum tripartitum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its elegant appearance and fragrance.
